attributes.action: Supervise people's mental health issues when they are prescribed dangerous drugs
attributes.background: My mother, who suffered from mental health issues, was given a weekly prescription of Amitriptyline without any supervision. My mother was saving them up over some time and committed suicide with these pills. Yes, they may be good for specific conditions, but not for vulnerable people.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable people suffering from mental health issues should be supervised when prescribed pills like Amitriptyline in a controlled environment with a healthcare professional. Sometimes people who are suffering from mental health problems don't think rationally like other people. They are vulnerable and need protection from harm. So why would you put them in harm’s way with lethal drugs? We lost my mother the worst way possible and it could have been prevented.

attributes.action: Scrap the tax on child support for victims of domestic abuse.
attributes.background: The Child Maintenance Service charges parents for utilising their managed service. The charge is in place to cut costs and encourage ex-partners to engage. Victims of domestic abuse shouldn't be punished financially because of an abusive ex-partner and, for safety, shouldn't be encouraged to engage.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government are taxing victims of domestic abuse every month for using their safest method of receiving Child Maintenance. At present, 4% of what a parent is entitled to is taken by the Government despite no other option being available.
This year, legislation to tackle domestic violence and abuse will come before the House of Commons. This petition is calling on the Government to use this opportunity to scrap the tax on child support for victims of domestic abuse.

attributes.action: Ban the culinary practice of boiling lobsters while still alive and conscious.
attributes.background:
The Swiss government is banning the culinary practice of boiling lobsters while they are still conscious.

This is in response to studies that suggest lobsters have advanced nervous systems and feel pain.

Lobsters can live for up to 50 years and the practice of boiling them alive is barbaric.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pain_in_crustaceans

"Opinion on the aspects of the biology and welfare of animals used for experimental and other scientific purposes". The EFSA Journal. European Food Safety Authority. 292: 1–46. 2005.

https://onekindplanet.org/uploads/publications/cephalopods-decapod-crustaceans.pdf

attributes.action: Prohibit the release of pheasants into the countryside for shooting
attributes.background: Every year approximately 35,000,000 pheasants are released into the countryside to be shot for sport. They are often intensively reared and little able to cope in the wild, with many killed by cars.This non-native species also causes massive damage to crops and gardens. This practice needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Most pheasants in the UK have not reproduced in the wild but have been released. 25% of those bred in captivity die before the shooting season even begins. Many birds are wounded when shot and not killed outright. They are hugely destructive, causing damage costing thousands of pounds. On compassionate and environmental grounds, their release should be prohibited.
https://www.gwct.org.uk/research/species/birds/common-pheasant/
http://robyorke.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2015/05/gamebird-release.pdf

attributes.action: Regulate animal rescue centres.
attributes.background:
Animal rescue centres are currently not regulated. This means that anyone can open as a rescue centre.
 
Regulation would allow for rules and guidelines to be issued and regular visits made to inspect that there is at minimum no breach of the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Make Zebra crossings safer for Pedestrians
attributes.background:
My Dad, a 91 year old Father of 5 Children, 16 Grandchildren and 7 Great Grandchildren was knocked down and killed whilst crossing the Road at a Zebra Crossing. 

Govt should look at position/ suitability of crossings ensuring that a pedestrian crossing is the safest place for people to cross
attributes.additional_details:
At the Old Bailey, the Driver was acquitted of causing 'death by careless driving'. Emphasis was placed on our Dad not paying attention when crossing at the Zebra crossing rather than the Driver of the Car being careless. 

We feel:

Zebra Crossings on main Roads, near Schools and junctions be changed to Pelican Crossings

The Highway Code needs to be changed to give pedestrians greater priority at crossings

The distance of a crossing from a junction should be standardised to at least 8 metres

attributes.action: UK Government to remove the race terms "Black" and "White" from its documents.
attributes.background: One of the earliest uses of black and white as metaphors for race was used in the 17th century when French Doctor François Bernier, an early proponent of scientific racism, divided up humanity based on facial appearance and body type.There were originally 4 colour groups, only black and white remain
attributes.additional_details:
They're opposites and ironically all race-related stereotypes associated with them are too. The connotations of these words compound positive and negative notions e.g. good, evil, weddings, funerals, white/black magic. The symbolic representations and emotions we identify with these words subconsciously effect us. 

This colour system assists in the paradigm of race hierarchy which has led to many irrational comparisons, historical/present animosity, privilege and discrimination amongst people. 

Every race is unique and has no opposite. Our race identity should be defined solely by our continents of origin (European/African/Asian etc), not colours. This reduces ignorance by connecting a person or group to countries, languages and cultures; qualities we love, share and have in common.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election if there is no deal on Brexit by September 2018
attributes.background: Leaving the EU without an agreement on our future relationship would be catastrophic in economic and human terms. If the government cannot deliver, our sovereign Parliament should be allowed to implement alternative arrangements, including dissolution and a General Election, to avoid this outcome.
attributes.additional_details: When people voted leave in the EU Referendum, there was no suggestion that we would choose to, or have to, leave without a deal. The government has not made any practical preparations for a no deal scenario, and  negotiations are not progressing fast enough. If the government cannot deliver, Parliament should take over and use whatever means necessary to avoid a no deal scenario. As this will involve a loss of confidence in the current government, a General Election should be held.

attributes.action: Make medical/ psychological support accessible for veterans in the UK a priority
attributes.background: Services currently provided for ex service personnel with PTSD does not meet their psychological needs leading to increased distress family breadowns and higher suicides
attributes.additional_details: Many of our service and veteran personnel suffer with crippling psychological damage often alone with their families trying to pick up the pieces alone. If we truly value the sacrifices our troops made for our country then we need to be prepared to provide the psychological support and welfare  they need to recover. Practitioners with experience and knowledge of PTSD linked to service rather than generalists who have no experience of combat stress.This has to be a priority of a civilised society

attributes.action: Ban prostitute review sites
attributes.background: There are sites where men review sex workers and their services. These sites are also a forum for online bullying, where they share personal details such as the real names of girls and their addresses, and nasty comments are all shared publicly for the world to see.

attributes.action: Change the UK law on rape to include female on male rape.
attributes.background:
THE LAW ON RAPE IS SEXIST

This is unjust and discriminates against men, as women who penetrate their own vagina with a man's penis against his will, can only be convicted of the lesser crime, which carries a
lower minimum sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that the law should be adapted to:

 (1) A person (A) commits an offence if-

  (a) A intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person (B) with his penis; 
                     or 
  (b) A intentionally penetrates their own vagina, anus or mouth with another person’s (B) penis: 
                    and:
 (c) B does not consent to the penetration, and 
  (d) A does not reasonably believe that B consents.

The Government said that it was committed to tackling sexual offending. Yet, today, according to the law, a woman, except in a few rare instances, cannot commit rape.

attributes.action: Ban the use of domestic Wood Burning Stoves to improve air quality for all
attributes.background: Wood burning stoves are becoming more and more common which is evidenced by the tangible and demonstrable drop in air quality in recent years. You do not need any scientific equipment to witness the drop in quality. Just step outside on any cold day or night and you will smell the foul acrid smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Breathing clean, unpolluted, fresh smelling air should be a basic human right, but yet in modern Britain it is not as people are permitted to set fire to wood in order to create heat, which is completely unnecessary in 2018. Household wood burners should be banned immediately before more people are duped into buying them under the green banner and releasing more harmful particulates into the air. It is a shame to think that breathing clean fresh crisp winter air is currently a thing of the past.

attributes.action: Stop the cuts to mental health services in Gateshead and Newcastle.
attributes.background:
People are suffering poor mental health more and more and the most needy are being over looked.
Good mental health is as important as physical health and more cuts to north east mental health services will make more suffer.
May promised no cuts and she has gone back on that promise.

attributes.action: The Houses of Parliament should erect a monument to Daniel O'Connell
attributes.background: Daniel O'Connell, often known as The Liberator or The Great Emancipator, was an Irish political leader. He campaigned, successfully, for Catholic Emancipation in the first half of the 19th century.
attributes.additional_details: O'Connell played a leading role in achieving Catholic Emancipation - including the right for Catholics to sit in the Westminster Parliament - and the values of egalitarianism, tolerance and human rights, which he helped instil, continue to underpin modern democracy around the world. A leading MP from 1828-1841, his philosophy and career inspired diverse others from Mahatma Gandhi to Martin Luther King Jr. to Nelson Mandela. It is time for O'Connell to be recognised with a monument in Parliament.

attributes.action: To Put Mental Health medication on to the exemption list for a free prescription
attributes.background: I have been on Bipolar Medication for a while. Like others who have various mental health problems, I can't get it for free as it is not on the exemption list. However I am on this medication for the rest of my life. It should be on the list because like most medications on the list, it's for life.
attributes.additional_details: Most people I know on these medications can't get it for free and have to pay £8.70 just for the medication, however people with thyroid problems and other problems can get it for free and all their other medications for free! Why when this is a condition that we must have our tablets every day otherwise become very ill and put into hospital can we not get it? This is an issue that needs to be spoken about mental health has to be spoken up about. It's difficult going through this and getting help.

attributes.action: Halt the scrapping of HMS OCEAN.
attributes.background: HMS Ocean is a very versatile and potent warship which this country needs to keep in service (or build a replacement). Its value is not only as an assault ship but as a humanitarian support vessel.

attributes.action: Update BE test rules to allow automatic cars to be used and gain manual as well
attributes.background: The BE driving licence rules need to be updated to allow people that take the test in an automatic to gain manual entitlement if they hold manual Cat B licence, as this is proving difficult for Trainers to buy suitable test vehicles, as more and more car manufacturers are stopping making manual cars
attributes.additional_details:
The rules were changed to allow Cat C and CE candidates to pass a test in an automatic truck and gain manual entitlement if they hold a manual Cat B licence, as more and more trucks were being made in automatic only.
This is now happening with car manufacturers and proving to be a problem to trainers in our industry.
Automatic vehicles are now more fuel efficient than manual vehicles so I feel the rules must be changed swiftly to enable us to help with reducing emissions to help our planet

attributes.action: Equal pay for 16 to 21 year olds
attributes.background: People under 21 are paid less then people over 21 years old, even if they are doing the same job, but 16 year olds are allowed to get married, have kids and join the armed forces. From 18 you can drink in a pub and more importantly vote so why shouldn't you have equal pay?

attributes.action: Improve mental health education in schools & make offering counselling required
attributes.background: The teaching of mental health becoming required was a huge step, but there’s a long way to go until support and info on mental health within schools is enough. Having anxiety and depression myself, I know that many people can be left alone or confused; it shouldn’t be seen as a minor topic to rush.
attributes.additional_details:
Counselling in schools should be offered and easy to access, eg if students were provided with questionnaires on their mental well-being once every few months, their mental state could be easily monitored and be offered support and extra info if needed.
- Around 850,000 5-16 yr olds suffer with mental illness (almost 1 in 10 / 3 per class)
-70% increase in self harm rates in 10-14 yr olds over past 2 years
-70% of young people with a mental illness don't get the appropriate support

attributes.action: Cut Foreign aid by half and use the £6.5 billion saved for the homeless.
attributes.background: Lets cut Foreign aid by half and use the £6.5 billion saved to get homeless people off the streets, into rehabilitation (where needed), and into houses and jobs.

attributes.action: Stop GP surgeries charging for medical letters for patients.
attributes.background: GP surgeries often ask for payment for providing medical letters to some of the most vulnerable patients. For many patients , being asked to pay up to £25 for a letter to prove their medical condition can lead to greater stress, anxiety, and a feeling of hopelessness. Medical letters must be free.

attributes.action: Remove the "Henry VIII Powers" from the European Union (Withdrawal) Bill
attributes.background:
When 37.5% of the electorate (51.9% of those who voted) voted to bring back power the UK Parliament, it was not their intention to immediately hand over that power to the Theresa May and her Government.

We fought 2 Civil Wars in England to give Parliament the power to control what is UK law.
attributes.additional_details:
In it's current form the European Union (Withdrawal) Bill gives the Government the power to change UK law without Parliamentary scrutiny.

This power can be used safely, such as amendments to the breeds of dog in the Dangerous Dogs Act, however it has also been abused. In 2013 Chris Grayling MP attempted to introduce a residency test barrier to obtaining legal aid.

There is a lot more at stake here: Consumer Protection, Employment, Snoopers Charter, Environmental Protection, rights of Appeal.

attributes.action: Alter the definition of rape under English law to include assault by penetration
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 states that rape is where "[the rapist] intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person B with his penis" and "B does not consent". People who are raped using an object or fingers are said to have been 'assaulted by penetration' and not raped.
attributes.additional_details: Using 'assault by penetration' to legally describe this act of rape downplays the experiences of people who have suffered in this way, and could prevent them from getting the support they need from rape shelters and therapy. It could cause additional psychological harm by preventing them from coming to terms with what happened to them, since 'assault by penetration' does not have the same stigma as the word 'rape'. So-called 'assault by penetration' can also cause PTSD, as can rape and other forms of sexual assault. The definition is also too simplistic as it does not take into account lack of consent in LGBT+ interactions and relationships, and implies that only men can rape.

attributes.action: Abolish Leasehold
attributes.background: Leasehold is a completely outdated law and should be abolished. Freeholders charge exorbitant amount for annual service charge and at the time of lease renewal. It is so inhumane that you spend your hard earned money and still treated as a tenant.

attributes.action: Make rail season tickets tax deductible for those on PAYE
attributes.background:
Presently individuals who pay tax via PAYE pay tax on the income earned to fund their rail season ticket.
 
It seems unjust that someone should have to pay taxation on income earned to fund a season ticked purchased for the purpose of commuting to work.

attributes.action: Make ear piercing in under 10s illegal.
attributes.background: I strongly believe that no child should be forced to have holes punctured in to their skin until they are old enough to understand what is involved.
attributes.additional_details: If you made a hole like that in any other part of a baby/child, you would have them taken away. Just because it has a gem in it, it's different? People say “It's better to get them done when they're little because they don't remember it”... It's not compulsory.

attributes.action: Make March 29th Brexit Bank Holiday
attributes.background: Celebrate our EU exit

attributes.action: Privatise the BBC as we did with other public services
attributes.background: Can we trust the BBC? Is it impartial? Does it have a political agenda? How does it spend the billions of pounds it receives in tax payers money? Why does the BBC exist?
attributes.additional_details: It is an unaccountable tax payer funded organisation. Admittedly it makes some good programs, but give anyone a couple of billion pounds and its likely they'll make a good program. What is the BBC's overseas policy? WHO actually does the BBC answer to?

attributes.action: Failure to pay a County Court Judgement results in a criminal offence.
attributes.background: I won a CCJ in civil dispute case. I was awarded £10,410.88. They failed to pay by the deadline summonsed by Court. High Court bailiffs have failed to retrieve the funds. This can happen to anyone. There is no protection in a civil dispute. I want the law to change to protect the public.

attributes.action: Give the electorate a referendum on the abolition of the House of Lords
attributes.background: The House of Lords is a place of patronage where unelected and unaccountable individuals hold a disproportionate amount of influence and power which can be used to frustrate the elected representatives of the people

attributes.action: Introduce 19 baby check questions in to prenatal & postnatal information given
attributes.background: 19 baby check questions may help identify if a baby has Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) risk. Should be included in prenatal & postnatal information from midwifes & health visitor. You are given leaflet about enviromental factors. Check List only available from charity which supports after SIDS.
attributes.additional_details: Studies show 19 question scored checklist may determine which babies are at risk of SIDS. It is based on many symptoms & signs that are not significant individually, but taken together may signify a risk of death. The Baby Check as a means of quantifying acute illness, can be used by parents to help them decide whether to seek medical attention. It can be used by health professionals as a tool to discriminate between those babies who should be assessed in hospital and those who need not be.

attributes.action: Strict Law on purchase of Acid
attributes.background: Increase in number of acid attacks everyday. It is very disappointing to know the easy availability of acid. It is not the face or body they destroy, they destroy the whole life of the victims. Acid should only be available to license holders.
attributes.additional_details: Acid attacks in London are increasing everyday. People have started attacking in groups now. It is very scary to walk in the street of London. It has to stop now! Acid should only be available to license holders and strict law should be enforced on each and every purchase of the substance. Lets make London a terror free place to live again!!

attributes.action: Maternity pay to reflect your regular salary.
attributes.background: Maternity pay is the same for everyone regardless of their usual earnings. A part time colleague took her full maternity leave as her pay was similar to her usual salary. I feel discriminated as a higher earner as I will need to return to work early as I will lose £1200 per month on maternity pay.

attributes.action: The NHS should give boys the HPV vaccine to prevent cancers later in life.
attributes.background: Boys will suffer from HPV related cancers later in life just as girls will if they aren’t given the HPV vaccine. Currently it is said to be cheaper to treat the cancers than to provide the vaccine. These are some of the few preventable cancers; lets act on this one!

attributes.action: Make 14 June 2018 a national day of mourning.
attributes.background: The appalling Grenfell Tower fire of 14 June 2017 deserves a fitting nationwide commemoration.

attributes.action: Make 16-25 railcard useable before 10am. Senior Citizens can use theirs anytime.
attributes.background: Under the current National Rail Conditions, young people who invest in a rail card cannot use it before 10am. Meanwhile, Senior Citizens can use their railcard anytime. After exhaustive enquiries with National Rail Conditions, there has been no clear explanation as to why these restrictions exist.
attributes.additional_details: After contacting National Rail Conditions enquiries, I tried to establish some clarity. After being placed on hold numerous times, he said the reason behind the restriction was due to a minimum fare of £3.90 between 4:30am -10am. This 'reduced' fare is actually the standard price and is available to everybody including Senior Citizens. So it still offers no valid explanation for this inverted ageism. Please join me by signing this petition to ensure national companies work for all!

attributes.action: To reopen Weston-Super-Mare's A&E between 10pm and 8am
attributes.background: W-S-M, A&E shut on July 4th 2017 due to the fragility of the emergency services due of the lack of senior doctors. At least 27 people use the emergency services each night; from those, 12 are transported by ambulance. Not having their local A&E at their disposal is endangering their lives.
attributes.additional_details:
One resident of Weston Super Mare stated,"We need our local A&E back. The delays encountered by ambulances having trawl between Taunton and Bristol are endangering lives."It's vital to keep this facility open 24 hours 7 days a week."
Another said..
"Please sign.. we need our local services. Bristol and Taunton are too far away, for the person having to care for them, for the ambulance service having to trawl back and forth and waiting times for ambulance services are endangering lives."

attributes.action: Get rid of all school uniforms
attributes.background: I personally find most school uniforms ridiculously uncomfortable and believe that we, as students, should be able to wear anything we like to school within reason. I also believe that if anyone should go to school in a uniform, it should be the teachers.

attributes.action: Charge for Missed NHS Appointments
attributes.background:
Whatever we think about our NHS, it is there for us all, day and night. But it is in trouble and something has to change. 
If we don’t respect it, we will lose it.  
£300 million pounds are lost in Missed Appointments. Charging for these would reduce DNA’s and create income.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent government survey showed 10 million GP Appointments are missed every year. 
This equates to £300 million pounds. 
If a £20 charge was made £200 million could be saved and the privilege of getting an appointment would be more respected. 
More Appointments would either be kept or would incur a no show cancellation charge as it in the private sector. If we do nothing to save our NHS, nothing will change. Please sign and share.

attributes.action: To authorise an amended version of the 1962 proposed Altrincham and Sale bypass.
attributes.background:
The A56 carries approx. 35,000 vehicles per day with HGVs and OGVs
contributing approx. 13.5% of this figure. Resulting air pollution affects peoples health, contributing to respiratory illness, heart disease and some cancers. Noise, road accidents, traffic congestion are other associated factors
attributes.additional_details:
Starting from the M60 Carrington Spur junction with Carrington Lane, going South across Carrington Moss towards Ashton Road joining the A56 west of the new A556 bypass, giving a direct link between the M60 jnc 8 to the M56 jnc 8 and onto the M6 jnc 19 via the new A556 intersections
Linking the M60 to the A56 west will create a new circular transportation network.
STOP THIS A56 TRAFFIC NIGHTMARE -BUILD THE ALTRINCHAM AND SALE BYPASS NOW.
Please sign the petition
Please sign this petition now.

attributes.action: Make the Union Jack a standard part of all public service uniforms & vehicles.
attributes.background: Our Police, Fire Brigade, Border Agency and other emergency and public services embody the very best of British and work hard to secure and protect the British public.
attributes.additional_details:
The Union Jack is already internationally recognised as a beacon of democracy, rule of law and freedom.

A country's flag is present on the public service uniforms and vehicles of many countries such as the USA, Spain and New Zealand but not ours.

With Brexit on the horizon, our national flag should become a standard element as part of our services' uniforms and vehicles to show the world our pride in queen, country, our country's values and the people whom they represent.

attributes.action: Void properties classed as dwelling or accommodation to be rented out or sold on
attributes.background: There are numerous properties across the UK that are owned but are classed by the local council as 'void' meaning empty.  Most of these properties would make good homes for local people who wish to either rent of buy.  There should be a maximum period where they remain empty, ie no more than 2 years
attributes.additional_details: Currently councils allow owners of void properties to pay double council tax in order  to remain empty for an indefinite period. Surely as there is a housing crisis and also a demand for social housing - most people cannot afford to buy - owners should not be allowed to sit on empty dwellings, whereby the purpose of the building is to be lived in? There should be a scheme for them to at least rent, as this would also provided much needed housing  also stop the building falling into disrepair.

attributes.action: To increase the length of imprisonment for Voyeurism to a minimum of 2 years.
attributes.background: Victims who are put through this vile offence are life changing, physically and mentally. Their ability to trust is taken away & yet the offender will only receive a maximum of 2 years imprisonment - with a 3rd off if they plead guilty. This is not in anyway justice for victims.
attributes.additional_details:
Voyeurism is an offence under the Sexual Offences Act 2003.

This offence consists of somebody watching/filming victims doing a private act without their consent. This can then be distributed over fake porn sites, social media and across the internet for others sexual needs. 2 years is not justice!

A private act can be from bathing, using a toilet, anything you would deem as private and personal, and people do not deserve to have their privacy taken and publicly distributed without knowing.

attributes.action: Undertake due diligence on Severn tolling to consider extending beyond end-2018
attributes.background: The abolition of the tolls will have serious economic consequences for the locality as resulting traffic growth impacts an already severely congested motorway network. A tolling extension will assist in the alleviation of congestion at little additional cost and aid WAG with relief road project time
attributes.additional_details: The M4 network in Wales is not equipped for the expected post-tolls traffic growth. Without the tolls ‘buffer’ any perceived financial boost to the economy will be effectively lost in the ensuing traffic chaos. The introduction of an extended tolling sliding scale regime (designed to collect 2018 tolls over 2018-2021) will have long lasting benefits. It will not compromise DfT debt recovery, end-users will not be financially disadvantaged, and it offers WAG a time extension for its relief scheme

attributes.action: Call PM to condemn Israeli human rights violations against Palestinian children
attributes.background: Palestinian children are being systematically arrested and imprisoned in Israel. Usually accused with throwing stones, these children are taken forcibly, imprisoned and interrogated without their parents or lawyers. They are subjected to military law and can face up to 20 year sentences.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/ajplusenglish/videos/1103514446456728/

attributes.action: Amend Equality Act 2010 by adding a provision for "Other" characteristics.
attributes.background: Change discrimination legislation, by adding another protected characteristic to the Equality Act 2010, namely "Other": a characteristic not included in the act but including traits/features/qualities, which could potentially attract discriminatory behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the only characteristics on which it is unlawful to discriminate are age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation and pregnancy/maternity. 
However, there is no recourse for people discriminated because of their weight, tattoos or sociocultural affiliation. This petition aims to change this by adding an “Other” option and thus not allowing people to be discriminated because of who they are within the rigid boundaries of the law, to be determined by Judges upon hearing and reading the evidence.

attributes.action: Stop the pothole pandemic ravaging communities through out the UK.
attributes.background: A call to increase allocation of funds to councils by the government for road care. Following the heavy snow through out the UK and lack of funds councils are already granted to care for the roads, many new potholes have emerged, old ones re-opened and previously ones left to fester and grow.

attributes.action: Require Petrol Stations and Airports to have free filtered Water Fountains.
attributes.background:
The goverment should mandate all Petrol Stations and Airports to provide the public with free, clean, filtered Water Fountatins.

Anybody could then refill their reusable water bottles for free.

This would dramatically cut down the amount of plastic bottles that are destroying our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Let's fight plastic waste at the source.  By providing the public with a safe and easy alternative.

When travelling it's easy to be caught short without enough water to get through the day, forcing many people to buy bottled water.  Let's change that.

Furthermore at airports we are not allowed to take our own water through security. 

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/travel/2017/07/revealed-no-water-fountains-in-more-than-half-of-uk-international-airports-

attributes.action: Stop NHS Surcharge Payment for Visa applications (NI contributions goes to NHS)
attributes.background: The Home Office has made it mandatory for immigrants to pay for NHS Surcharge as part of Visa application while working immigrants in the UK pay National Insurance contribution that fund other state benefits and the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The NHS Surcharge cost £200 per year and this means immigrants have to pay an excess of £200 every time they apply to renew their Visa on top of their high visa charge. For someone applying for 5 years visa, this will amount to an extra £1000. National Insurance contribution means that immigrants are already paying contribution towards funding the NHS and should be given the right to access medical treatment and not treated differently from EU and UK citizens with regards to accessing the NHS

attributes.action: Life skills should be compulsory education from the age of 5 yrs to 18 yrs
attributes.background: Young adults don't have the life skill required to become a valued member of the community, they need to understand how our society works, tax, social services and amenities, having an enormous financial cost to our society,they also do not understand relationships, social responsibly and parenting
attributes.additional_details:
I have found that many young people become adults, not having a basic understanding of how our society functions, they don't know about the tax system, how the welfare state works or is funded, they don't understand social responsibly, 
This proposal would give a child 13 years of education on how relationships work ,respecting other, parenting skills, budgeting skill, becoming part of the community and understanding that responsibility.
It would also help understand social responsibility
